forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Snow. Cloudy, with a low around 28. West wind around 3 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New snow accumulation of less than half an inch possible.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Snow. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 32. Northwest wind 2 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New snow accumulation of 1 to 2 inches possible.

weather_report:
In the quiet embrace of the early morning, Boston is shrouded in a gentle snow, each flake a fleeting dance that settles on the world, painting it white. The clouds hang low, muffling the sounds of the city and cloaking it in a soft haze. As the temperatures hover near freezing, a slight breeze rustles through, adding a chill that seeps into the bones, reminding one that winter has well and truly arrived. This evening's snowfall will be joined by a more resolute gathering of flakes tomorrow, ensuring the streets are graced by a thicker layer, transforming the familiar into a winter wonderland.

For those contemplating the day, dressing in layers will serve as your shield against the crisp air—a warm hat, perhaps a knitted scarf, and stout boots will keep you comfortable as you traverse the snowy landscape. With the biting wind and beautiful snowfall accompanying your steps, there’s a certain magic in the air. Taking a moment to enjoy a warm drink from a cozy café, or wandering through the snow-dusted parks, might find a place in your plans. Alternatively, curling up with a good book in the embrace of your own home could also be a sanctuary of choice, as the snow blankets the city in a serene quietude.
